stories.text:
Hello, I work as a senior engineer at company, where I'm objectively doing good.

I've recently got a new offer from another company for the same role but with a 40% increase in salary. When discussing with my current employer, they said they would really like to keep me but to kind of match that offer they need to give me a promotion too (as tech lead) but I don't really feel like it's natural for me at my current level to take that kind of job for the moment (I have 4 years experience total) especially since my team will only consist of one person (more to be recruited in the next 2 years), and it's the person that I get along with the least in the team.

what's the possible career path in this case ? get the best title whenever possible ? get the job with the best salary for less responsibility ? My goal is to make tye best decision that will help move further in my career.
stories.title: 40% raise with same job title or 40% raise with a (kind of) promotion
